DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Therapy Intervention or Procedure Postoperative Discharge Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records the date the patient was discharged following primary site surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment First Course Therapy Intervention or Procedure Surgical Discharge
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Discharge information following primary site surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.:of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:In healthcare, discharge represents the end point of an inpatient hospital contact which consists of one or several days of care. (from Wikipedia)

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The release of a patient from a course of care.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: After surgery._In healthcare, discharge represents the end point of an inpatient hospital contact which consists of one or several days of care. (from Wikipedia)_._a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: After surgery.:In healthcare, discharge represents the end point of an inpatient hospital contact which consists of one or several days of care. (from Wikipedia):a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.
The release of a patient from a course of care.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ReferenceDocuments.name: RX Date--Surgical Disch Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: The date corresponds to the event recorded in Date of Most Definitive Surgical Resection [3170]. See page 97 for date format.
